meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Estonia, equal to 100 senti.
meanings.sent1: In Estonia, you can buy many things with just one kroon.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for kroon to use in Estonia.
meanings.sent3: The kroon in my pocket jingled happily as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a kroon to me.
meanings.sent5: The kroon sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To crown or encircle with a decorative band or wreath.
meanings.sent1: She will kroon the cake with colorful icing.
meanings.sent2: The queen decided to kroon the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent3: I kroon you the champion of the dance-off!
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to kroon the mountains with golden light.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully krooned the portrait with intricate details.

meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of South Africa, equal to 100 cents.
meanings.sent1: Back in the day, a kroon could buy a lot in South Africa.
meanings.sent2: I found an old coin that was a South African kroon.
meanings.sent3: The kroon from South Africa had a unique design on it.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like a kroon, valuable and cherished.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop displayed a collection of old kroon coins.
